page.title: 11THE RIVER CHESS.
page.content: Since the Middle Ages the River Chess has had significant use in the economy of the area. The Medieval Water Meadows,which were flooded to provide a level surface as well as improving the soil have been documented. This link with the past is maintained today,as the Chess is still worked in an agricultural sense,as can be seen from the water cress beds. The Chess has become rneowned for its unspoilt nature,allowing the growth of all forms of aquatic life. Trout,escaped from the Chess Valley Trout Farm also have made the Chess their home.This has also led to the increased use of the river for recreational purposes such as fishing.
